Issues.Title: docs(docs-infra): fix (notation of) microsyntax grammar
Issues.Body:
# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report ### What's the affected URL? https://angular.io/guide/structural-directives#grammar ### Description The current grammar is defined by the following production rules: *:prefix="( :let | :expression ) (';' | ',')? ( :let | :as | :keyExp )*" keyExp = :key ":"? :expression ("as" :local)? ";"? let = "let" :local "=" :export ";"? as = :export "as" :local ";"? I describe several issues of the used notation and grammar rules. Each issue and my suggested solution is described in a section. The sections are separated by a horizontal line in the following. The presented solutions build on the (changes of the) previous solutions. The last section shows the final result (production rules). --- **Issue:** Production rule `*:prefix` is not formatted consistently. **Solution:** Use one space character before and after `=`. Use one space character before `(` and no space character after `(`. Use no space character before `)`. Use one space character after `)` if it is not followed by an operator (`?` or `*`). Otherwise, only write one space character after the operator, but only if the operator is not followed by `)`. *:prefix = " (:let | :expression) (';' | ',')? (:let | :as | :keyExp)* " --- **Issue:** Prefix `:` of nonterminal symbols creates no added value. **Solution:** Remove `:` *prefix = " (let | expression) (';' | ',')? (let | as | keyExp)* " keyExp = key ":"? expression ("as" local)? ";"? let = "let" local "=" export ";"? as = export "as" local ";"? --- **Issue:** No consistent use of double quotation marks `"` in the production rules. `"` is used as terminal symbol in production rule `*prefix`, but as delimiter of string literals (sequence of terminal symbols) in the other production rules `keyExp`, `let` and `as`. **Solution:** Use `'` as delimiter and surround the double quotation terminal symbol with delimiters: *prefix = '"' (let | expression) (';' | ',')? (let | as | keyExp)* '"' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? ';'? let = 'let' local '=' export ';'? as = export 'as' local ';'? --- **Issue:** Assignment of `export` to `local` variable is mandatory in production rule `let`, but the implementation allows to omit explicit assignment, like `let x` in

{{x}}

which is treated like an implicit assignment of the special context property `$implicit` to `x`. **Solution:** Make assignment optional in production rule `let`: let = 'let' local ('=' export)? ';'? --- **Issue:** The current grammar definition allows the production of two consecutive semicolons, see derivation example: *prefix = '"' (let | expression) (';' | ',')? (let | as | keyExp)* '"' = '"' (let ) ';' (let | as | keyExp)* '"' = '"' ('let' local ('=' export)? ';'?) ';' (let | as | keyExp)* '"' = '"' 'let' local '=' export ';' ';' (let | as | keyExp)* '"' But the current implementation throws `Template parse errors` in that case, for example:

{{i}}: {{x}}

**Solution:** Extract semicolon production from rule `let` into rule `*prefix` and move separator production `(';' | ',')?` to the alternative `expression`: *prefix = '"' (let ';'? | expression (';' | ',')?) (let ';'? | as | keyExp)* '"' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? ';'? let = 'let' local ('=' export)? as = export 'as' local ';'? --- **Issue:** Production rules do not consider that (terminal symbol) colon may be used instead of semicolon separator. For example

{{i}}: {{item}}

can not be produced using the current rules due to the colon after `myTrack`, but it is valid syntax in the implementation. **Solution:** Define production rule `sep` (abbreviation of *separator*): *prefix = '"' (let sep? | expression sep?) (let sep? | as | keyExp)* '"' sep = ';' | ',' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? sep? let = 'let' local ('=' export)? as = export 'as' local sep? This can be simplified by moving `sep?` around in the definitions *prefix = '"' (let | expression) sep? ((let | as | keyExp) sep?)* '"' sep = ';' | ',' keyExp = key ':'? expression ('as' local)? let = 'let' local ('=' export)? as = export 'as' local This code block represents my **final suggestion**.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs(docs-infra): fix (notation of) microsyntax grammar" (#33436)

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): update bazel-schematics to use Ivy and new rollup_bundle
Issues.Body:
Note: the @angular/bazel schematic now prepends the package.json "script" field with `ngcc; ` if there is an existing script field. ViewEngine sources under node_modules need to be updated in-place for Bazel as it does not know how to use the `__ivy__` entry points that are created by the non-bazel `ngcc` command that is added to "scripts" :`ngcc --properties es2015 browser module main --first-only --create-ivy-entry-points`.

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): avoid generating selectors array for directives without a selector
Issues.Body: Now that we've replaced `ngBaseDef` with an abstract directive definition, there are a lot more cases where we generate a directive definition without a selector. These changes make it so that we don't generate the `selectors` array if it's going to be empty.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ivy): avoid generating selectors array for directives without a selector" (#33431)

Issues.Title: build: bump maximum allowed yarn version
Issues.Body: Currently this repo allows Yarn between 1.17.3 and 1.18.0, whereas the components repo requires a minimum of 1.19.1 which makes it annoying to switch between repositories. These changes bump the maximum allowed Yarn version.

Issues.Title: Decorator of AsyncValidator example should be a Directive not an Injectable
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The Decorator shouldn't be an Injectable as in the example.

It should be a Directive:
`@Directive({
  selector: '[uniqueAlterEgoValidator]',
  providers: [{
      provide: NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS,
      useExisting: UniqueAlterEgoValidatorDirective,
      multi: true
    }
  ]
})`

I want to point out, that you need to provide NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS instead of NG_VALIDATORS, which wasn't documented in the guide.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/guide/form-validation#implementing-custom-async-validator
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Decorator of AsyncValidator example should be a Directive not an Injectable" (#33429)

Issues.Title: --stats-json generates broken output
Issues.Body:
This issue probably caused because if ivy enabled ### Is this a regression? Yes, when ivy was not enabled feature was working correctly ### Description 1. before ivy there was 2 stats.json files present: `stats-es5.json` and `stats-es2015.json` Now only `stats-es2015.json` geneated 2. In newly created `stats-es2015.json` there is a link to broken polyfill bunlde file, like: `polyfills-es5-es2015.hash.js` there are two different files produced during the build: `polyfills-es5.hash.js` and `polyfills-es2015.hash.js` but `stats-es2015.json` refers to nonexistant file ## Minimal Reproduction Create new project with ivy enabled, run `ng build --prod --stats-json` inspect produced bundle - es5 report is missing try to run `webpack-bundle-analyzer stats-es2015.json --mode static --report webpack.html` it will fail becouse of refference to missing file. ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
Angular CLI: 8.3.9
Node: 10.16.3
OS: linux x64
Angular: 8.2.10
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: DomSanitizer.sanitize return value if input was not safe
Issues.Body:
I am trying to display e-mails fetched from an IMAP server on my webapp.

Currently I am importing DomSanitizer
`import { DomSanitizer } from "@angular/platform-browser";`
And I declare it as sanitizer in my constructor
`private sanitizer: DomSanitizer`

When I fetch for the e-mail, I call the DomSanitizer.sanitize function on the e-mails HTML.
`letter.safeHtml = this.sanitizer.sanitize(1, res.html);`

However, I want the user to be notified in case that some of the HTML has been stripped and have the user hit a button and run DomSanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustHtml if they accept the warning.

Therefore I request that the DomSanitizer.sanitize function returns null if the content provided was not safe or perhaps create another function like isSafe(SecurityContext, value) which would return true/false;
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DomSanitizer.sanitize return value if input was not safe" (#33423)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): handle elements with local refs in i18n blocks
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, i18n logic which ensures that elements removed in a translation are also removed in DOM, didn't take into account the fact that elements may have local refs. As a result, remove operation failed, since there is no corresponding tNode found. This commit updates the logic to skip all local refs while going though the list of nodes to ensure that DOM matches elements present in translation.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: [wip] Rollup es2015 & then downlevel to es5 for language-service bundle
Issues.Body:
***Branches off of nodejs rules 0.39.0 PR #33426 which should land first.***

Testing replacing ls_rollup_bundle with the new @bazel/rollup rollup_bunde which can only handle es2015 inputs at the moment (the esm5 re-rooting does not work with it). Instead of rolling up esm5, this PR changes the language-service bundle to be a rollup of es2015 + a babel downlevel step.

The new bundle differs from the original. I'll attach the two for comparison.

Issues.Title: Param Map for Activated Route Contains Incorrect Param Keys
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? I do not know if this issue existed in previous versions. ### Description Retrieving values from the param map for the activated route does not work as expected. I was following the routing section of the tour of heroes tutorial https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5. After defining the parameterized route for the hero details component, i noticed the details would not appear when clicking on a hero (from both the list and the dashboard). The URL displayed in the address bar was correct (i.e. /heroes/details/11), and the href attribute in the rendered html was also correct. After stepping through the debugger (in VS Code), i discovered that the parameter key in the route map was stored as "id}" instead of id. When i updated my code to retrieve the value passing "id}" as the key name, it worked as expected and the details were displayed for the selected hero. It appears as though one of the ending "}" chars from the binding syntax in the template is not being dropped when the key/value pair is added to the activated route's param map. This issue was found using Firefox 69.0.3 and was not tested in other browsers. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/johnluisi/angular-demo-bug ## 🔥 Exception or Error ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 8.3.14
Node: 12.13.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.2.12

... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic

Issues.Title: ngc reports "cli/lib/config/schema" module not found
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?
Angular newb so I have no idea.


### Description
This import fails:

angular/cli/commands/add-impl.d.ts:7:    readonly packageManager: import("../../../../dist-schema/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema").PackageManager;

however:

```
$ ls -al node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.*
[snip] node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.d.ts
[snip] node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.js
[snip] node_modules/@angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json
```

so the file it probably wants is ```schema.d.ts```.  

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

My package.json scripts includes 
```
    "postinstall": "ngc -p ./angular-metadata.tsconfig.json"
```
so ```npm install``` triggers the ngc which emits the error.

For reference,
angular-maetadata.tsconfig.json is

    },

        "node_modules/@angular/**/testing/**",

}

```

node_modules/@angular/cli/commands/add-impl.d.ts(7,37): error TS2307: Cannot find module '../../../../dist-schema/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema'.

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| [rollup](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup) | dependencies | minor | [`1.25.2` -> `1.26.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/rollup/1.25.2/1.26.0) |

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v1.26.0`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1260)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v1.25.2...v1.26.0)

_2019-10-27_

##### Features

-   Only warn when no output is provided for an IIFE bundle but still produce valid code ([#​3181](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3181))
-   Support reexporting namespaces as a binding ([#​3193](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3193))
-   Switch from hash.js to crypto for hashing in the Node build for better performance and support for very large assets ([#​3194](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3194))

##### Bug Fixes

-   Correctly handle chunks reexporting the same namespace as two different bindings ([#​3193](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3193))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3181](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3181): Remove the need to provide an output name for IIFE bundles ([@​bterrier](https://togithub.com/bterrier))
-   [#​3193](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3193): Add support for "export \* as name from …" ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3194](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3194): Add support for large assets (> 100 MB) ([@​SebastianNiemann](https://togithub.com/SebastianNiemann))

</details>

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>zloirock/core-js</summary>

### [`v3.3.4`](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​334---20191025)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/compare/v3.3.3...v3.3.4)

-   Added a workaround of V8 deoptimization which causes serious performance degradation (~20x in my tests) of some `RegExp`-related methods like `String#split`, [#​306](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/306)
-   Added a workaround of V8 deoptimization which causes serious performance degradation (up to 100x in my tests) of `Array#splice` and slightly `Array#{ filter, map }`, [#​677](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/677)
-   Fixed work of `fetch` with polyfilled `URLSearchParams`, [#​674](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/674)
-   Fixed an edge case of `String#replaceAll` with an empty search value
-   Added compat data for Chrome 80
-   `package-lock.json` no longer generated in libraries

</details>

Issues.Title: ng update fails on latest angular cli
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? N/A ### Description ng update --all fails on a new project ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction 1. install latest angular cli `yarn global add @angular/cli ` 2. create a new project `ng new projectname` 3. cd into project 4. run `ng update --all` 5. observe We shouldn't have any incompatible peer dependencies. We have two: 1. Package "@angular/core" has an incompatible peer dependency to "zone.js" (requires "~0.9.1", would install "0.10.2"). 2. Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): only ngcc in prepare
Issues.Body: This fix is to make is so an npm/yarn install with --production mode will not fail as ngcc won't have been installed yet. This allows for workflows with docker and other production build mechanics.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): only ngcc in prepare" (#15939)

Issues.Title: build: update autoprefixer to version 9.7.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [autoprefixer](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer) | dependencies | minor | [`9.6.5` -> `9.7.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/autoprefixer/9.6.5/9.7.0) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/autoprefixer ### [`v9.7.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/releases/9.7.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/compare/9.6.5...9.7.0) Autoprefixer 9.7 brings `AUTOPREFIXER_GRID` environment variable and huge performance improvments. #### Grid Environment Variable Autoprefixer can add [CSS Grid polyfills for IE](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer#does-autoprefixer-polyfill-grid-layout-for-ie). You need to manually enable it to prove that you understand the limits of polyfill. In previous versions you can enable Grid polyfill by `grid: 'autoplace'` option or by `/* autoprefixer grid: autoplace */` control comment. But in some cases, developers were not able to use both methods. For instance, during [work with Material UI’ CSS-in-JS in Create React App](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1257). Now Autoprefixer supports environment variable to enable CSS Grid polyfill: ```sh AUTOPREFIXER_GRID=autoplace npm build ``` #### Performance Improvements [@​Knagis](https://togithub.com/Knagis) [found](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1256) that Browserslist takes 70% of the Autoprefixer time. ![Autoprefixer 9.6.5 profiling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19343/67489064-e0a10400-f6ab-11e9-895b-1507608e2446.png) We did a lot of improvements in Browserslist and now Autoprefixer should work much faster. ![67417985-a283e180-f5d2-11e9-879a-e364c9acccf1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19343/67489142-01695980-f6ac-11e9-96a2-c2cc169b6767.png) #### Other - Fix [`Cannot read property 'grid' of undefined`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/issues/1244) error
--- ### Renovate configuration :date: **Schedule**: "after 10pm every weekday,before 4am every weekday,every weekend" in timezone America/Tijuana. :vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied. :recycle: **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or if you modify the PR title to begin with "`rebase!`". :no_bell: **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again. --- - [ ] If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box --- This PR has been generated by [Renovate Bot](https://togithub.com/marketplace/renovate). View repository job log [here](https://renovatebot.com/dashboard#angular/angular-cli).

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [puppeteer](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer) | dependencies | major | [`1.12.2` -> `2.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/puppeteer/1.12.2/2.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>GoogleChrome/puppeteer</summary>

### [`v2.0.0`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/releases/v2.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/compare/v1.20.0...v2.0.0)

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 79.0.3942.0 (r705776)
-   Puppeteer now requires Node.js v8+; Node.js v6 is no longer supported
-   `page.screenshot` now clips elements to the viewport ([#​5080](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5080))
-   New APIs:
    -   [`page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatetimezonetimezoneid)
    -   [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) (superseding the old [`page.emulateMedia(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatype) API)
    -   [`page.emulateMediaFeatures(features)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype)

#### API changes

-   New API: [`page.emulateTimezone(timezoneId)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatetimezonetimezoneid) ([#​4949](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4949))
-   New API: [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))
-   Deprecated API: [`page.emulateMedia(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatype) is now obsolete. Use [`page.emulateMediaType(type)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) instead. ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))
-   New API: [`page.emulateMediaFeatures(features)`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v2.0.0/docs/api.md#pageemulatemediatypetype) ([#​5012](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/5012))

#### Raw notes

### [`v1.20.0`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/releases/v1.20.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/compare/v1.19.0...v1.20.0)

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 78.0.3882.0 (r686378)
-   New APIs: [`element.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatepagefunction-args), [`element.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args), [`element.select`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleselectvalues), [`jsHandle.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatepagefunction-args), [`jsHandle.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args)

#### API changes

##### Added

-   [`element.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`element.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`element.select`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#elementhandleselectvalues) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`jsHandle.evaluate`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))
-   [`jsHandle.evaluateHandle`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.20.0/docs/api.md#jshandleevaluatehandlepagefunction-args) ([#​4892](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/pull/4892))

#### Big Changes

-   Chromium 77.0.3844.0 (r674921)
-   New [File Chooser API](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.19.0/docs/api.md#class-filechooser) to handle file chooser dialogs.

#### API changes

##### Added

-   [`class: FileChooser`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.19.0/docs/api.md#class-filechooser) ([`ea28ccc`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/ea28cccfe021a22d1772ee4abfdf67d646aa6c17))
-   [`page.waitForFileChooser()`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/blob/v1.19.0/docs/api.md#pagewaitforfilechooseroptions) ([`ea28ccc`](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/commit/ea28cccfe021a22d1772ee4abfdf67d646aa6c17))

#### Bug Fixes

[#​2946](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/2946) - Handling File Input Dialogs
[#​4300](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4300) - `backgroundpage.on('console')` not working
[#​4374](https://togithub.com/GoogleChrome/puppeteer/issues/4374) - puppeteer.launch({ pipe: true }) may crash due to unhandled stream errors

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): remove several deprecated APIs
Issues.Body:
refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): remove several deprecated APIs

BREAKING CHANGE:

Removed several deprecated APIs:

- EngineHost `listSchematics` has been removed in favour of `listSchematicNames`.
- `FileSystemSink` - Use the new virtualFs.Host classes from `@angular-devkit/core`.
- `optimize` function has been remove as trees are automaticlly optimized.
- `DryRunSink` deprecated constructor that allowed to provide a directory path has been removed. Provide a `virtualFs.Host` instead.

Issues.Title: ng generate module produce wrong code for specific code pattern
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description The `ng generate module` produce wrong code. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction ```sh ng new demo1 --routing --style css cd demo1 ng g c test1 ``` Add route config in `src/app/app-routing.module.ts` just like below: ```ts const route1 = { path: 'test1', component: Test1Component }; const routes: Routes = [ route1 ]; ``` Then I creating an lazy-loaded module named `test`. ```sh ng g module test --route test --module app ``` Then the route config will turn into this. And this is wrong. ```ts const route1 = { path: 'test1', component: Test1Component }; const routes: Routes = [, { path: 'test', loadChildren: () => import('./test/test.module').then(m => m.TestModule) } route1 ]; ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

ERROR in Cannot read property 'loadChildren' of undefined
## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.3.13
Node: 10.16.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.2.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: feat: add coercion for string arrays
Issues.Body:
Adds a utility function to coerce string arrays. This has been very useful for CSS class lists or defining columns for a CDK table.

Handling of `null` and `undefined` (and objects) may be up for discussion. Currently they are mapped via [string interpolation](https://github.com/JanMalch/components/blob/feat/coerce-string-array/src/cdk/coercion/string-array.ts#L15) and [not filtered](https://github.com/JanMalch/components/blob/feat/coerce-string-array/src/cdk/coercion/string-array.spec.ts#L10).

(If this is not just a "small" feature, I'm happy to open up a new issue.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: add coercion for string arrays" (#17523)

Also fixes some tests that won't fail if the tree doesn't render anything.

Issues.Body: Stops sliding on `touchcancel` events in the `mat-slider`, in addition to `touchend`.

Issues.Title: refactor(overlay): remove deprecated connected position strategy
Issues.Body:
The `ConnectedPositionStrategy` has been deprecated since at least 7.0.0 and is just a wrapper around `FlexibleConnectedPositionStrategy`. These changes remove it since it still adds a fair bit of code that has to be maintained.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `ConnectedPositionStrategy` has been removed. Use `FlexibleConnectedPositionStrategy` instead.

Issues.Title: Angular Material: Audio player component
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

There should be support for an Angular Material audio player component which would ideally be a wrapper over the native `<audio>` element in HTML.

The component should also expose outputs when the audio's playback state is toggled or when a new audio URL is set.

The component should ideally be easy for developers to set up the player.

There should also be support for playlists which most music applications implement.

(P.S. I was inspired by this library created by @vmudigal: https://github.com/vmudigal/ngx-audio-player. However, I would like to see this integrated into the main set of components available.)

#### Use Case

This feature would allow users to easily include this audio player in their app without having to create a custom player or use external 3rd-party components.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material: Audio player component" (#17513)

Issues.Title: Incorrect work of drag-and-drop with ng-container in ivy
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction repo for reproducing: https://github.com/nmatushevskiy/ivy-ng-container-bug-repro/ Steps to reproduce: 1. npm i 2. ng serve 3. Try dragging any item #### Expected Behavior Items being dragged correctly with using ng-container https://stackblitz.com/github/nmatushevskiy/ivy-ng-container-bug-repro (example without ivy) Code example: ```
{{item}}
``` #### Actual Behavior Dragging works incorrectly with using ng-container and ivy. With this code: ```
{{item}}
``` Have the following behavior: ![Снимок экрана 2019-10-25 в 17 49 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67580994-e8b27f80-f74f-11e9-9c1e-08692577b30b.png) And this, if I try to drag a few items: ![Снимок экрана 2019-10-25 в 17 49 40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67581009-ed773380-f74f-11e9-9b8e-f941369a2008.png) #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.0-next.13 - CDK/Material: 8.2.3 / 9.0.0-next.0 (I tried both) - Browser(s): Chrome v. 78.0.3904.70 - Operating System: macOS #### Workaround drag and drop works correct without ng-container. For example: ```
{{item}}
``` #### Comment By debugging established: in `drop-list.ts` (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/directives/drop-list.ts) in `ngAfterContentInit` method there are no items: ![Снимок экрана 2019-10-25 в 18 32 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67584542-92950a80-f756-11e9-9f41-0207eeffb72a.png) While without ivy all items received: ![Снимок экрана 2019-10-25 в 18 35 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67584683-d6880f80-f756-11e9-9f0c-79e61b04f344.png) Also, with ivy doesn't work output `cdkDropListDropped`. By comparing code with and without ivy it was found out: in `drag-ref.ts` (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drag-ref.ts) in method `_endDragSequence`, `this._dragDropRegistry.isDragging` returns false, so the code below is not being executed. Thats why the output is not called. ![Снимок экрана 2019-10-25 в 18 48 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67585959-3bdd0000-f759-11e9-9a6e-187bb6898889.png) While without ivy `this._dragDropRegistry.isDragging` returns true and output called correctly ![Снимок экрана 2019-10-25 в 18 58 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56971144/67586131-8e1e2100-f759-11e9-9d6f-79f301c2e47c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect work of drag-and-drop with ng-container in ivy" (#17505)

Issues.Title: ivy: Boolean inputs cause compile errors
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

(StackBlitz doesn't seem to support ivy)

Steps to reproduce:
1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next`
2. `ng new app`
3. `ng add @angular/material`
4. `ng update @angular/material --next`
5. Add a basic [button example](https://material.angular.io/components/button/examples) with a boolean input:

```html
<button mat-button disabled>Disabled</button>
```
 
#### Expected Behavior
The build should pass

#### Actual Behavior
```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:339:22 - error TS2322: Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.

339   <button mat-button disabled>Disabled</button>
                         ~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```

This usage is prevalent in Material and CDK (e.g. `cdkTrapFocus`), so it's causing a lot of errors for consumers experimenting with ivy. Any input that relies on [`coerceBooleanProperty()`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/cd0a47e204c20481bf3534c9f1046049eaa63308/src/cdk/coercion/boolean-property.ts#L10) is subject to this problem.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0-next.13
- CDK/Material: 9.0.0-next.0
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ivy: Boolean inputs cause compile errors" (#17495)
